intro: Micropholis egensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorean micropholis, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in lowland and montane rainforests, growing as an understory plant. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
